text: The Britannica Dictionary mobile search Home Ask the Editor Word of the Day Quizzes Core Vocabulary Browse the Dictionary × Britannica Homepage Ask the Editor Word of the Day Quizzes Core Vocabulary Browse the Dictionary The Britannica Dictionary four 11 ENTRIES FOUND: four (noun) four–letter word (noun) four–poster (noun) four–star (adjective) four–wheel (adjective) four–wheel drive (noun) all fours (noun) petit four (noun) twenty–four seven (adverb) two–by–four (noun) 4x4 (noun) four / ˈ foɚ/ noun plural fours four / ˈ foɚ/ noun plural fours Britannica Dictionary definition of FOUR 1 [ count ] : the number 4 2 [ count ] : the fourth in a set or series the four of hearts [+] more examples [-] hide examples [+] Example sentences [-] Hide examples 3 [ noncount ] : four o'clock “What time is it?” “It's four .” I leave each day at four .
